text.__SUMMARY__:
Grevillea ripicola, commonly known as Collie grevillea, is a shrub which is endemic to the south west region of Western Australia. It  grows to between 0.6 and 2 metres in height and  up to 4 metres in width.  
The species was first formally described by botanist Alex George in Nuytsia in 1974 based on plant material collected at Collie. It is classified as Priority Four Flora (Rare) under the Wildlife Conservation Act in Western Australia.
